Name: United Kingdom
Passport Validity: Must be valid for the duration of your stay in the United Kingdom (At least six months remaining validity is required for onward travel to many other countries)
Tourist visa: Not required for stays under 90 days

Name: United Kingdom
Passport Validity: Must be valid for the duration of your stay in the United Kingdom (At least six months remaining validity is required for onward travel to many other countries)
Tourist visa: Not required for stays under 90 days

Name: United Kingdom
Passport Validity: Must be valid for the duration of your stay in the United Kingdom (At least six months remaining validity is required for onward travel to many other countries)
Tourist visa: Not required for stays under 90 days

Name: Israel, the West Bank and Gaza
Passport Validity: No minimum requirement, but your authorized stay will not exceed the validity remaining of your passport and airlines may decline boarding if a traveler has less than six months validity on his or her passport
Passport pages: 1 page (although passports are normally not stamped upon entry)
Tourist visa: Not required for stays of 90 days or less. Please see below for detailed information about entry, exit and visa requirements
Currency entry: You must declare if you are carrying 50,000 shekels or more when entering or exiting Israel by air and 12,000 shekels if entering or exiting by land
Currency Exit: You must declare if you are carrying 50,000 shekels or more when entering or exiting Israel by air and 12,000 shekels if entering or exiting by land

Name: French West Indies
Passport Validity: Must have six months validity at entry
Tourist visa: Not required for stays under 90 days

Name: Eswatini
Passport Validity: Six months
Tourist visa: No, if staying 30 days or less
Vaccionations: Yellow fever, if entering from a yellow fever country

Name: Macedonia
Passport Validity: Six months beyond your planned stay recommended
Passport pages: One page required for entry stamp
Tourist visa: Not for stays less than 90 days within a six month period
Currency entry: 10,000 Euros or equivalent must be declared
Currency Exit: 10,000 Euros or equivalent must be declared

Name: Aruba
Passport Validity: Must be valid at time of entry and for duration of stay
Passport pages: One page required for entry stamp
Tourist visa: None
Vaccionations: Yellow fever required if arriving from select countries

Name: Afghanistan
Passport Validity: Must be valid for six months at time of entry
Passport pages: One page required for entry stamp
Tourist visa: Yes
Vaccionations: Polio vaccination up to 1 year before travel is recommended. See the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention Fact Sheet

Name: Angola
Passport Validity: 6 months from date of entry
Tourist visa: Yes

Name: Anguilla
Passport Validity: Must be valid at time of entry
Tourist visa: Not required if you have an onward or return ticket, confirmation of accommodation, and can produce evidence of your ability to maintain yourself

Name: Albania
Passport Validity: Three months
Passport pages: One page required for entry stamp
Tourist visa: Not required for stays under one year. If you intend to stay more than a year in Albania, you will need to apply for a residency permit
Vaccionations: Required. One must bring evidence of vaccination if arriving from countries as listed by www.who.int
Currency entry: 1,000,000 lekë (approximately $9,500 USD at time of publication, though the rate can fluxuate) or equivalent
Currency Exit: 1,000,000 lekë (approximately $9,500 USD at time of publication, though the rate can fluxuate) or equivalent. For more information you can visit Albanian Customs website.

Name: Andorra
Passport Validity: 6 months recommended before entry into Andorra, although only 3 months are required.
Tourist visa: None required for stays less than 90 days in Spain, France, or Andorra.

Name: United Arab Emirates
Passport Validity: 6 months validity after date of arrival
Passport pages: One page required for entry stamp
Tourist visa: Not required for tourist stays under 30 days

Name: Argentina
Passport Validity: Must be valid at time of entry
Passport pages: One page required for entry stamp
Tourist visa: Not required for stays of 90 days or less
Currency Exit: Up to US$10,000 or equivalent undeclared for those over age 16; up to US$5,000 or equivalent undeclared for those under 16

Name: Armenia
Passport Validity: Must be valid at time of entry and departure
Tourist visa: None for U.S. Citizens staying for less than 180 days per year

Name: Antarctica
Passport Validity: Required by transit countries
Passport pages: May be required by transit countries.
Tourist visa: None for Antarctica. May be required by transit countries.

Name: Antigua and Barbuda
Passport Validity: 180 days following your departure date
Tourist visa: No, but see entry-exit requirements below

Name: Australia
Passport Validity: Must be valid at time of entry
Passport pages: One page required for entry stamp
Tourist visa: Yes – visa or Electronic Travel Authority (ETA)
Currency entry: Amounts over AUD 10,000, or equivalent, must be declared
Currency Exit: Amounts over AUD 10,000, or equivalent, must be declared

Name: Austria
Passport Validity: 6 months beyond planned date of departure from from the Schengen area
Passport pages: One page required for entry stamp
Tourist visa: : Not required for stays under 90 days within each 180 day period

Name: Azerbaijan
Passport Validity: Six months
Tourist visa: Yes
Currency entry: Travelers may bring in any amount of foreign currency as long as they declare it upon arrival
Currency Exit: Travelers may depart Azerbaijan with up to $10,000 USD in cash. Travelers may depart with up to $50,000 USD or equivalent provided that they declared the cash amount in writing upon arrival. For more information on currency operations, please visit the official website of the Central Bank of the Republic of Azerbaijan

Name: Burundi
Passport Validity: N/A
Tourist visa: N/A

Name: Belgium
Passport Validity: Must be valid for at least three months beyond your planned date of departure from the Schengen area. The 12-page U.S. emergency passport is not valid for visa-free entry into Belgium.
Tourist visa: Not required for stays under 90 days

Name: Benin
Passport Validity: Must be valid at time of entry
Passport pages: One page required for entry stamp
Tourist visa: Yes

Name: Bonaire, Sint Eustatius and Saba
Passport Validity: Must be valid for period of stay.
Passport pages: One page required for entry stamp
Tourist visa: None required for visits up to 180 days

Name: Burkina Faso
Passport Validity: Must be valid at time of entry
Passport pages: One blank page required for entry stamp
Tourist visa: Yes

Name: Bangladesh
Passport Validity: Six months beyond planned stay.
Tourist visa: Yes. Although U.S. citizens are eligible to apply for a tourist visa on arrival, there is no guarantee they will receive one. Some U.S. citizens have been denied entry into Bangladesh despite believing they had fulfilled the requirements for a visa on arrival.
Vaccionations: Hepatitis A and Typhoid vaccinations required; Hepatitis B, Japanese Encephalitis, and Rabies vaccinations recommended.  There is no risk of Yellow Fever in Bangladesh; however, proof of Yellow Fever vaccination is required if you are traveling from a country with a risk of Yellow Fever and are older than one year of age.
Currency entry: You must declare 5,000 U.S. dollars and above.
Currency Exit: You cannot depart with more USD than you declared upon entry. You cannot take more than 5,000 Bangladeshi taka out of Bangladesh.

Name: Bulgaria
Passport Validity: Three months beyond departure date from Bulgaria.
Passport pages: One blank page for entry/exit stamps.
Tourist visa: No for stays under 90 days.

Name: Bahrain
Passport Validity: 6 months
Tourist visa: Yes

Name: Bahamas
Passport Validity: Must be valid at time of entry
Passport pages: Two pages are required for entry stamp
Tourist visa: No

Name: Bosnia and Herzegovina
Passport Validity: Three months past your planned date of departure
Passport pages: One page required for entry stamp
Tourist visa: Not required for stays under three months
Currency entry: Amounts exceeding 10,000 Euros or equivalent must be declared on arrival
Currency Exit: Amounts exceeding 10,000 Euros or equivalent require a bank certificate that the amount has been taken out from currency savings or bought from an authorized bank

Name: Belize
Passport Validity: Length of stay
Tourist visa: Not required for stays of 30 days or less

Name: Bermuda
Passport Validity: Must be valid at time of entry
Passport pages: One page required for entry stamp
Tourist visa: No

Name: Bolivia
Passport Validity: Six months (as of entry date into the country)
Tourist visa: Yes

Name: Brazil
Passport Validity: Must be valid on the date of entry
Passport pages: One page required for entry stamp
Tourist visa: Yes
Vaccionations: None required, but see Health section
Currency entry: More than 10,000 BR must be declared to Customs
Currency Exit: More than 10,000 BR must be declared to Customs

Name: Barbados
Passport Validity: Must be valid at time of entry
Tourist visa: Not required for stays under 6 months

Name: Bhutan
Passport Validity: Six months from date of arrival
Passport pages: One page required for entry stamp
Tourist visa: Yes

Name: Botswana
Passport Validity: 6 months
Passport pages: Three or more unused pages; one blank page per entry
Tourist visa: No
Vaccionations: Yes, if entering from yellow fever endemic countries

Name: Central African Republic
Passport Validity: 6 months
Passport pages: One page required for entry stamp
Tourist visa: No, but may still be required by airline.
Currency entry: All currency must be declared upon entry

Name: Canada
Passport Validity: Valid at time of entry. If you are transiting Canada en route to Europe, your passport must be valid for at least 3 months beyond your planned date of departure from the Schengen area.
Tourist visa: Not required for stays under 180 days

Name: Switzerland
Passport Validity: At least six months beyond your planned date of departure from the Schengen area
Tourist visa: Not required for stays of less than 90 days
Currency entry: No restrictions; officers may question over 10,000 Swiss Francs (CHF)
Currency Exit: No restrictions; officers may question over 10,000 Swiss Francs (CHF)

Name: Chile
Passport Validity: For the duration of stay
Passport pages: One page required for entry stamp
Tourist visa: Not required for stays of 90 days or less (tourist passports only)

Name: China
Passport Validity: Six months
Tourist visa: Yes

Name: Côte d'Ivoire
Passport Validity: 6 months validity upon entry
Tourist visa: Yes
Currency Exit: May not leave with more than $1,000

Name: Republic of the Congo
Passport Validity: 6 months
Tourist visa: Yes, obtain in advance

Name: Colombia
Passport Validity: Must be valid at time of entry.
Passport pages: One page required for entry stamp.
Tourist visa: Not required for stays 90 days or less.
Vaccionations: Yellow fever vaccine, documented on the WHO International Certificate of Vaccination, is required for travelers coming from Brazil, Angola, Democratic Republic of Congo, and Uganda. The vaccine must have been administered at least 10 days before arrival in Colombia.

Name: Comoros
Passport Validity: Must be valid at time of entry
Tourist visa: Yes, available upon arrival

Name: Cabo Verde
Passport Validity: Must be valid at time of entry
Passport pages: One page required for entry stamp
Tourist visa: Yes
Currency Exit: Certificates from Bank of Cabo Verde required to depart with more than 1 million Cabo Verdean escudos

Name: Costa Rica
Passport Validity: Length of stay
Tourist visa: Not required for stays less than 90 days, but return ticket required
Vaccionations: Yellow fever, if arriving from certain countries in South America or Africa

Name: Cuba
Passport Validity: Must be valid at time of entry
Passport pages: Two pages are required for entry/exit stamps
Tourist visa: Tourist travel to Cuba remains prohibited. You must obtain a license from the Department of Treasury or your travel must fall into one of 12 categories of authorized travel. See ENTRY, EXIT & VISA REQUIREMENTS below.
Vaccionations: None required. See CDC for recommendations
Currency entry: U.S. credit and debit cards generally do not work in Cuba. Bring cash to cover your stay. The Cuban government requires that travelers declare cash amounts over 5,000 USD. Travelers should note that the Government of Cuba charges a 10 percent fee for all U.S. dollar cash conversions; this does not apply to electronic transactions or cash conversions in other currencies.
Currency Exit: The export of Cuban convertible pesos (CUC) is strictly prohibited, regardless of the amount. When departing Cuba, U.S. travelers are advised to exchange Cuban convertible pesos (CUC) back to US Dollars well before reaching airport security checkpoints to avoid potential confiscation of the CUC. For other currencies, travelers may export up to the equivalent of 5,000 USD. Anyone wishing to export more than this amount must demonstrate evidence that the currency was acquired legitimately from a Cuban bank.

Name: Curaçao
Passport Validity: Must be valid for duration of trip. More information on entry requirements here
Passport pages: One page required for entry stamp
Tourist visa: None
Vaccionations: Only if arriving from a country with yellow fever risk.

Name: Cayman Islands
Passport Validity: Must be valid at the time of entry and exit
Passport pages: One page required for entry stamp
Tourist visa: None required

Name: Cyprus
Passport Validity: Six months remaining validity recommended
Tourist visa: Not required for stays under 90 days

Name: Czech Republic
Passport Validity: Six months recommended, Three months beyond departure date from the Schengen area.
Tourist visa: Not required for stays less than 90 days.
Currency entry: €10,000+ euros or equivalent must be declared.
Currency Exit: €10,000+ euros or equivalent must be declared.

Name: Germany
Passport Validity: Six months beyond planned date of departure from the Schengen area
Tourist visa: Not required for stays under 90 days.

Name: Djibouti
Passport Validity: 6 months
Tourist visa: Yes

Name: Dominica
Passport Validity: Must be valid at time of entry
Tourist visa: Not required for stays under 6 months

Name: Denmark
Passport Validity: Six months is recommended
Tourist visa: Not required for stays under 90 days

Name: Dominican Republic
Passport Validity: Must be valid at time of entry
Tourist visa: Not required for visits shorter than 30 days
Vaccionations: None required if arriving from the United States
Currency Exit: $10,000 and over or its equivalent must be declared

Name: Algeria
Passport Validity: Minimum of six months remaining on entry
Passport pages: One page required for entry stamp
Tourist visa: Yes, unless entering via cruise ship
Currency entry: Travelers must declare at Customs if they are traveling with more than 3000 Algerian dinar or foreign currency that exceeds 1000 euros (or equivalent)
Currency Exit: Algerian dinars cannot be taken out of the country

Name: Ecuador
Passport Validity: 6 months.
Tourist visa: No, for stays less than 90 days in any 12-month period.
Currency Exit: There is a 5 percent tax on currency taken out of Ecuador above $1098.00. See the Ecuadorian Revenue Service website.

Name: Egypt
Passport Validity: Must have six months validity
Tourist visa: Yes

Name: Eritrea
Passport Validity: 6 months
Tourist visa: Yes
Currency Exit: Declare amounts over $10,000 USD, Maximum allowed 1000 Nakfa

Name: Spain
Passport Validity: 6 months recommended, 3 months beyond your date of departure is required
Tourist visa: Not required for stays less than 90 days

Name: Estonia
Passport Validity: Should be valid for at least six months beyond your stay
Tourist visa: None

Name: Ethiopia
Passport Validity: 6 months
Tourist visa: Yes
Currency Exit: 1,000 ETB (4,000 ETB if travelling to Djibouti) and $3,000

Name: Finland
Passport Validity: Six months recommended
Tourist visa: None required

Name: Fiji
Passport Validity: At least six months after your scheduled departure from Fiji
Passport pages: One page required for entry stamp
Tourist visa: Not required for stays of fewer than four months
Currency entry: Currency over F$10,000 or the U.S. dollar equivalent must be declared
Currency Exit: Currency over F$10,000 or the U.S. dollar equivalent

Name: France
Passport Validity: Must be valid for at least three months beyond your planned date of departure from the Schengen area. The 12-page U.S. emergency passport is not valid for visa-free entry into France.
Passport pages: Must have at least one blank page for stamps
Tourist visa: Not required for stays under 90 days

Name: Micronesia
Passport Validity: Six months
Tourist visa: Not required
Vaccionations: A valid international certificate of vaccination is required for travelers coming from a region infected with small pox, yellow fever, or cholera
Currency entry: You must declare amounts equivalent to $10,000 or above.

Name: Gabon
Passport Validity: 6 months
Tourist visa: Yes

Name: United Kingdom
Passport Validity: Must be valid for the duration of your stay in the United Kingdom (At least six months remaining validity is required for onward travel to many other countries)
Tourist visa: Not required for stays under 90 days

Name: Georgia
Passport Validity: N/A
Tourist visa: N/A

Name: Ghana
Passport Validity: 6 months validity
Tourist visa: Yes

Name: Guinea
Passport Validity: 6 months validity
Tourist visa: Yes
Currency Exit: No more than 100,000 FG or $5,000 USD

Name: The Gambia
Passport Validity: Valid for duration of stay
Tourist visa: Yes

Name: Guinea-Bissau
Passport Validity: Valid at time of Entry
Tourist visa: Yes

Name: Equatorial Guinea
Passport Validity: 6 months
Tourist visa: Not required for stays of less than 90 days
Vaccionations: Proof of vaccination for yellow fever and polio required. A polio booster dose is required for those who have completed the normal series of the polio vaccine.

Name: Greece
Passport Validity: Six months of remaining validity recommended
Tourist visa: Not required for stays less than 90 days; visa required for all official and diplomatic passport holders

Name: Grenada
Passport Validity: 6 months beyond the date of entry.
Tourist visa: No, but see entry-exit requirements below
Vaccionations: None, unless arriving from regions with endemic Yellow Fever

Name: Guatemala
Passport Validity: 6 months beyond date of entry
Tourist visa: Not required for stays of 90 days or less

Name: French Guiana
Passport Validity: Three months

Name: Guyana
Passport Validity: Six Months
Tourist visa: No

Name: Hong Kong
Passport Validity: One month beyond the date of your intended stay
Passport pages: One page required for entry stamp
Tourist visa: Not required for stays under 90 days

Name: Honduras
Passport Validity: Passport must have six months validity.
Passport pages: One page required for entry stamp.
Tourist visa: No for stays of up to 90 days.
Vaccionations: Required: Honduras currently requires travelers arriving from Panama and every nation in South America to present proof of yellow fever vaccine.
Currency entry: Travelers must declare any amount over $10,000.
Currency Exit: Travelers must declare any amount over $10,000.

Name: Croatia
Passport Validity: Three months after the planned date of departure
Passport pages: One page is required for an entry stamp
Tourist visa: No

Name: Haiti
Passport Validity: 6months
Tourist visa: Yes, for stays over 90 days

Name: Hungary
Passport Validity: Six months validity recommended; three months validity beyond planned departure date from the Schengen area required.
Tourist visa: Not required for stays under 90 days
Currency entry: Amounts over 10,000 Euros or equivalent to declare at customs
Currency Exit: Amounts over 10,000 Euros or equivalent to declare at customs

Name: Indonesia
Passport Validity: 6 months beyond date of arrival
Tourist visa: No (for tourist travel under 30 days)

Name: India
Passport Validity: Must be valid for six months beyond date of visa application to obtain a visa
Tourist visa: Yes
Vaccionations: Required for yellow fever if the traveler is arriving from an infected area; others are suggested
Currency entry: The possession of satellite phones is prohibited in India
Currency Exit: Check local law for reporting requirements for exiting with large quantities of foreign currency and Indian rupees

Name: Ireland
Passport Validity: Must be valid for the duration of your stay in Ireland
Passport pages: Must have at least one page
Tourist visa: No

Name: Iran
Passport Validity: 6 months
Passport pages: One page required for entry stamp
Tourist visa: Yes, except for Kish Island

Name: Iraq
Passport Validity: Minimum of six months remaining on entry
Passport pages: One page required for entry stamp
Tourist visa: Yes
Vaccionations: None required. Vaccinations recommended by the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

Name: Israel, the West Bank and Gaza
Passport Validity: No minimum requirement, but your authorized stay will not exceed the validity remaining of your passport and airlines may decline boarding if a traveler has less than six months validity on his or her passport
Passport pages: 1 page (although passports are normally not stamped upon entry)
Tourist visa: Not required for stays of 90 days or less. Please see below for detailed information about entry, exit and visa requirements
Currency entry: You must declare if you are carrying 50,000 shekels or more when entering or exiting Israel by air and 12,000 shekels if entering or exiting by land
Currency Exit: You must declare if you are carrying 50,000 shekels or more when entering or exiting Israel by air and 12,000 shekels if entering or exiting by land

Name: Italy
Passport Validity: Must have at least six months validity remaining beyond your planned date of departure from the Schengen area.
Passport pages: Two pages required for entry stamp
Tourist visa: Not required for stays under 90 days

Name: Jamaica
Passport Validity: Must be valid at the time of entry and exit
Tourist visa: Only for a stay over 90 days
Vaccionations: Yellow fever vaccine required if traveling from a country with yellow fever risk

Name: Jordan
Passport Validity: Six months
Passport pages: One page required for entry stamp
Tourist visa: Yes. Jordan issues single-entry visas to U.S. citizens upon arrival at Queen Alia International Airport and most international land border crossings
Currency entry: Declaration required if greater than JOD10,000 or the equivalent in other currencies

Name: Japan
Passport Validity: Duration of intended period of stay
Passport pages: One page required for entry stamp
Tourist visa: Not required for stays of less than 90 days
Currency entry: Amounts equivalent to ¥1,000,000 or above subject to declaration
Currency Exit: Amounts equivalent to ¥1,000,000 or above subject to declaration

Name: Kenya
Passport Validity: 6months
Tourist visa: Yes

Name: Kyrgyzstan
Passport Validity: Six Months from date of entry
Tourist visa: Yes, for stays longer than 60 days
Currency entry: Up to the equivalent of 3,000 USD.
Currency Exit: Up to the equivalent of 3,000 USD.

Name: Cambodia
Passport Validity: Six months.
Passport pages: One page is required for entry stamp.
Tourist visa: Yes.
Currency entry: The import of local currency (Riel) is prohibited. When entering Cambodia, foreign currency amounts over US $10,000 must be declared.
Currency Exit: The export of local currency (Riel) is prohibited. Foreign currency can be taken out of the country up to the limit declared at customs on arrival.

Name: Kiribati
Passport Validity: Six months
Tourist visa: Not required for stays up to 30 days

Name: Saint Kitts and Nevis
Passport Validity: Must have six months validity at entry
Tourist visa: Not required for stays under 90 days

Name: South Korea
Passport Validity: Must be valid at time of entry
Tourist visa: None required for stays under 90 days or less

Name: Kuwait
Passport Validity: Six months from date of arrival; emergency passports accepted with conditions as of May 1, 2018 (see further instructions below).
Tourist visa: Yes; can be obtained on arrival at Kuwait International Airport or online. Visa validity is usually 90 days, subject to Kuwait’s discretion
Vaccionations: None for temporary visitors.  Please refer to Kuwait’s Ministry of Health website for a schedule of vaccinations required for residents of Kuwait

Name: Lao People's Democratic Republic
Passport Validity: 6 months from date of entry
Tourist visa: Yes
Currency entry: The import of local currency is not permitted. 2,500 USD or equivalent in foreign currency must be declared.
Currency Exit: The export of local currency is no permitted. 2,500 USD or equivalent in foreign currency must be declared.

Name: Lebanon
Passport Validity: Must be valid for ninety days following entry, with no Israeli stamps or visas
Passport pages: One page required for entry stamp
Tourist visa: Yes

Name: Liberia
Passport Validity: Valid at time of entry
Tourist visa: Yes
Currency Exit: No more than $7,500 at one time

Name: Libya
Passport Validity: Valid at time of entry
Tourist visa: Yes
Currency entry: The import of local currency for both residents and non-residents is prohibited.
Currency Exit: The export of local currency for both residents and non-residents is prohibited.

Name: Saint Lucia
Passport Validity: Must have six months validity at entry
Tourist visa: No, but see entry-exit requirements below

Name: Switzerland
Passport Validity: At least six months beyond your planned date of departure from the Schengen area
Tourist visa: Not required for stays of less than 90 days
Currency entry: No restrictions; officers may question over 10,000 Swiss Francs (CHF)
Currency Exit: No restrictions; officers may question over 10,000 Swiss Francs (CHF)

Name: Sri Lanka
Passport Validity: Must be valid for six months from expected date of departure from Sri Lanka.
Passport pages: One page required for entry stamp.
Tourist visa: Yes
Vaccionations: Required for yellow fever if arriving from an infected area.
Currency entry: Foreign currency over USD 15,000 must be declared.
Currency Exit: If exiting with foreign currency over USD 5,000, the full amount brought in or acquired in Sri Lanka must be declared.

Name: Lesotho
Passport Validity: Must be valid at time of entry; 3 months of remaining validity suggested
Tourist visa: Not required if stay is less than 180 days
Vaccionations: Yellow fever if traveling from or through a yellow fever endemic country.

Name: Lithuania
Passport Validity: 6 months recommended
Tourist visa: Not required for stays under 90 days

Name: Luxembourg
Passport Validity: 6 months is recommended in the Schengen area
Tourist visa: Not required for stays less than 90 days

Name: Latvia
Passport Validity: 6 months recommended.
Tourist visa: Not required for stays less than 90 days within a six month period.

Name: Macau
Passport Validity: One month beyond the intended period of stay
Passport pages: One page required for entry stamp
Tourist visa: Not required for stays under 30 days

Name: Morocco
Passport Validity: Must have at least six months of validity at time of entry
Passport pages: One page required for entry stamp
Tourist visa: Not required for stays under 90 days
Currency Exit: Export of Moroccan currency is prohibited

Name: France
Passport Validity: Must be valid for at least three months beyond your planned date of departure from the Schengen area. The 12-page U.S. emergency passport is not valid for visa-free entry into France.
Passport pages: Must have at least one blank page for stamps
Tourist visa: Not required for stays under 90 days

Name: Moldova
Passport Validity: 6 months
Tourist visa: Not required for stays of up to 90 days within a six-month period

Name: Madagascar
Passport Validity: 6 months at the time of entry

Name: Maldives
Passport Validity: Must be valid Must be valid for six months from expected date of departure from Maldives.
Passport pages: One page required for entry stamp
Tourist visa: Visitor visa available at the airport for stays up to 30 days

Name: Mexico

Tourist visa: Yes, if visiting for more than 180 days

Name: Marshall Islands

Name: Mali
Passport Validity: Valid at the time of entry
Tourist visa: Yes

Name: Malta
Passport Validity: Must be valid for at least three months beyond your planned date of departure from the Schengen area.
Passport pages: One page required for entry stamp
Tourist visa: Not required for stays less than 90 days

Name: Burma

Passport pages: One page required for entry stamp
Tourist visa: Yes

Currency Exit: Amounts in excess of USD 10,000 must be declared upon exit

Name: Montenegro

Passport pages: One page required for entry stamp
Tourist visa: Not required for stays under 90 days

Name: Mongolia

Name: Mozambique
Passport Validity: 6 months from entry into Mozambique
Tourist visa: Yes
Vaccionations: Yellow Fever if endemic country recently visited (although sometimes applied more broadly to travelers from other places)

Name: Mauritania

Name: Montserrat

Name: Mauritius

Name: Malawi

Name: Malaysia

Name: Namibia

Name: New Caledonia

Passport pages: One page required for entry stamp
Tourist visa: Not required for stays under 90 days per six months
Currency entry: None if arriving from another EU member state. If arriving from a country outside the EU, amounts exceeding EUR 10,000 or the equivalent in another currency must be declared.
Currency Exit: None if traveling directly to another EU member state. If travelling to a country outside the EU, amounts exceeding EUR 10,000 or the equivalent in another currency must be declared.

Name: Niger
Passport Validity: Must be valid at time of entry
Passport pages: Two pages are required for entry stamp
Tourist visa: Yes

Name: Nigeria
Passport Validity: N/A
Tourist visa: N/A

Name: Nicaragua
Passport Validity: Length of stay
Tourist visa: No (90 days or fewer). Tourist card at airport. See Entry, Exit & Visa Requirements below
Vaccionations: Yellow fever (in some cases, see Entry Requirements section)
Currency entry: Must declare $10,000 USD or more in cash

Name: Netherlands
Passport Validity: A passport must be valid for at least six months beyond planned date of departure from the Schengen area.
Passport pages: Two pages required for entry stamp
Tourist visa: Not required for stays under 90 days

Name: Norway
Passport Validity: Six months recommended
Tourist visa: Not required for stays under 90 days
Currency entry: 25,000 Norwegian Kroner (or equivalent), not including traveler’s checks
Currency Exit: 25,000 Norwegian Kroner (or equivalent), without prior approval

Name: Nepal
Passport Validity: Must have six months remaining validity or more at time of entry
Passport pages: At least one blank visa page (not endorsements page) required for entry visa
Tourist visa: Yes
Currency entry: US$5,000; no pure, unworked gold up to 50 grams of gold jewelry, or 500 grams of silver

Name: Nauru
Passport Validity: Three months
Tourist visa: Yes
Currency Exit: Up to AUD $2,500; permit required for amounts exceeding AUD $2,500

Name: New Zealand
Passport Validity: Three months beyond the planned date of departure from New Zealand
Passport pages: One page required for entry stamp
Tourist visa: Not required for stays of less than three months
Currency entry: If you bring 10,000 NZD or more in cash or foreign equivalent, you will be required to complete a Border Cash Report

Name: Oman
Passport Validity: 6 months
Tourist visa: Yes
Vaccionations: Yellow fever (when coming from an area with yellow fever outbreaks)

Name: Pakistan
Passport Validity: Six months beyond the date of arrival
Passport pages: Two blank pages are required for entry and exit stamps
Tourist visa: Yes
Vaccionations: Polio vaccination within one year before travel may be required to exit Pakistan. See Entry, Exit & Visa Requirements below and our Health Abroad page for more information.

Name: Panama
Passport Validity: 3 months beyond date of arrival
Tourist visa: No
Vaccionations: Yellow fever for passengers entering from countries with endemic yellow fever

Name: Peru
Passport Validity: Must have six months validity at time of entry
Passport pages: One page required for entry stamp
Tourist visa: Free, issued at the port of entry
Currency entry: USD 30,000. More than USD 10,000 must be declared upon entry

Name: Philippines
Passport Validity: Must be valid at time of entry
Passport pages: Sufficient space for an entry visa stamp
Tourist visa: Not required for stays under 30 days
Vaccionations: Required for travelers from countries with yellow fever

Name: Palau
Passport Validity: 6 months
Tourist visa: Not for tourists visiting for one year or less
Vaccionations: Cholera and yellow fever vaccines required for visitors from affected area
Currency entry: Amounts over 10,000.00 USD must be declared
Currency Exit: Amounts over 10,000.00 USD must be declared

Name: Papua New Guinea
Passport Validity: 6 months.
Tourist visa: Available upon arrival at the international airport for stays of fewer than 60 days.
Vaccionations: None required. U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention strongly recommends polio vaccinations, along with boosters for adults, for travel to Papua New Guinea. Vaccinations and boosters may be required for travel to Australia after extended stays in PNG.
Currency entry: More than PGK 10,000 must be declared.
Currency Exit: More than PGK 10,000 must be declared.

Name: Poland
Passport Validity: Six months remaining validity strongly recommended; at least three months remaining validity beyond planned departure from the Schengen area is required
Tourist visa: Not required for stays under 90 days

Name: North Korea
Passport Validity: 1-3 months validity (North Korea requirement); 6 months validity (China requirement)
Passport pages: Two pages are required for entry stamp
Tourist visa: Yes
Currency Exit: Not permissible to take Korean money out of the country

Name: Portugal
Passport Validity: 6 months beyond the intended date of departure
Tourist visa: Not required for stays under 90 days

Name: Paraguay
Passport Validity: Must be valid at time of entry
Tourist visa: Yes

Name: French Polynesia
Passport Validity: Six months
Tourist visa: Not required for U.S. citizens for stays under 90 days

Name: Qatar
Passport Validity: 6 months
Tourist visa: Yes

Name: Romania
Passport Validity: Three months beyond departure date. We recommend a minimum of six months validity after entry date
Tourist visa: Not required for stays under 90 days

Name: Russian Federation
Passport Validity: Required six months beyond intended stay
Tourist visa: Yes
Currency Exit: You may export up to $3,000 (or equivalent) without declaring it

Name: Rwanda
Passport Validity: 6 months
Tourist visa: Yes

Name: Saudi Arabia
Passport pages: One page required for entry stamp.
Tourist visa: Yes
Currency entry: More than 16,000 USD must be declared. Customs details are here.
Currency Exit: More than 16,000 USD must be declared. Customs details are here.

Name: Sudan
Passport Validity: 6 months beyond date of departure from Sudan
Tourist visa: Yes

Name: Senegal
Passport Validity: Valid at time of entry
Tourist visa: Obtainable upon arrival

Name: Singapore
Passport Validity: Six months
Passport pages: Two page requirement for entry stamp
Tourist visa: Not required for stays under 90 days
Vaccionations: Yellow fever for travelers from certain countries

Name: Solomon Islands
Passport Validity: Must be valid at time of entry
Tourist visa: No
Currency entry: Currency equivalent to 50,000 SBD or more must declared.
Currency Exit: Currency equivalent to 50,000 SBD or more must declared.

Name: Sierra Leone
Passport Validity: Six months
Tourist visa: Yes

Name: El Salvador
Passport Validity: Passport must be valid at time of entry.
Tourist visa: No, a visa is not required. But you must purchase a tourist card for 10 USD upon arrival. The card is valid for 90 days. If your U.S. passport shows you were born in El Salvador, you do not need the tourist card.
Vaccionations: None, check recommendation in Health Section.
Currency entry: Currency in excess of 10,000 USD must be declared.
Currency Exit: Currency in excess of 10,000 USD must be declared.

Name: Italy
Passport Validity: Must have at least six months validity remaining beyond your planned date of departure from the Schengen area.
Passport pages: Two pages required for entry stamp
Tourist visa: Not required for stays under 90 days

Name: Somalia
Passport Validity: Duration of stay
Tourist visa: Yes
Vaccionations: Yellow Fever vaccination is not required but most countries that fly in and out of Somalia require proof of vaccination

Name: Serbia
Passport Validity: Must be valid at time of entry
Passport pages: One page required for entry stamp
Tourist visa: Not required for stays under 90 days

Name: South Sudan
Passport Validity: 6 months
Tourist visa: Yes, obtain in advance.

Name: Sao Tome and Principe
Passport Validity: Six months
Tourist visa: Yes, for stays over 15 days
Currency Exit: Report required when exiting with more than 10,000 Euros (see below)

Name: Suriname
Passport Validity: Six months
Tourist visa: Yes
Vaccionations: Yellow fever (in some cases; see Health section)

Name: Slovakia
Passport Validity: Six months
Passport pages: One page required for entry stamp
Tourist visa: Not required for stays less than 90 days within a six-month period

Name: Slovenia
Passport Validity: Six months recommended; at least three months beyond your planned departure from the Schengen area
Passport pages: One page required for entry stamp
Tourist visa: Not required for stays under 90 days within each 180-day period

Name: Sweden
Passport Validity: At least six months beyond the period of stay
Passport pages: Space for entry and exit stamps
Tourist visa: Not required for stays under 90 days

Name: Sint Maarten
Passport Validity: Must be valid for duration of stay.
Passport pages: One page required for entry stamp.
Tourist visa: None.
Vaccionations: Only if arriving from a country with yellow fever risk.
Currency entry: Amounts exceeding USD 11,000 (or equivalent) must be declared.
Currency Exit: Amounts exceeding USD 11,000 (or equivalent) must be declared.

Name: Seychelles
Passport Validity: Duration of stay
Tourist visa: No, visitor permits granted upon arrival with return ticket
Vaccionations: Yellow fever, if traveling from a yellow fever endemic country

Name: Syria
Passport Validity: Must be valid at time of entry
Passport pages: One page required for entry stamp
Tourist visa: Yes

Name: Turks and Caicos Islands
Passport Validity: Duration of stay
Tourist visa: Only for visits over 90 days

Name: Chad
Passport Validity: 6 months
Tourist visa: Yes, obtain in advance

Name: Togo
Passport Validity: Must be valid at time of entry
Tourist visa: Yes

Name: Thailand
Passport Validity: 6 months from date of entry recommended
Tourist visa: No, if your stay is less than 30 days
Vaccionations: Yellow fever may be required if arriving from certain countries with yellow fever

Name: Tajikistan
Passport Validity: Six months
Tourist visa: Yes

Name: Turkmenistan
Passport Validity: 6 months. Because dual citizenship is not recognized, dual nationals are often denied departure from the country.
Tourist visa: Yes

Name: Timor-Leste
Passport Validity: Six months
Passport pages: One page required for entry stamp
Tourist visa: Yes

Name: Tonga
Passport Validity: Six months
Passport pages: One page required for entry stamp
Tourist visa: Not required for stays up to 31 days
Currency Exit: Maximum remittance of TOP $10,000 via bank/financial institution. Approval required for higher amounts

Name: Tunisia
Passport Validity: 6 months validity after date of arrival
Passport pages: One page required for entry stamp
Tourist visa: Not required for stays under 90 days
Currency entry: Import of Tunisian currency is prohibited. Visitors must declare cash brought into Tunisia in excess of TND 10,000 (or foreign currency equivalent). They must declare amounts above TND 5,000 if they wish to export that amount upon departure.
Currency Exit: Export of Tunisian currency is prohibited. Up to TND 3,000 may be re-exchanged into foreign currency upon departure from Tunisia with the original exchange receipt. Visitors may only export up to TND 5,000 (or foreign currency equivalent) if that amount was declared upon arrival.

Name: Turkey
Passport Validity: Six months beyond date of entry
Passport pages: One page for entry and exit stamps
Tourist visa: Yes

Name: Tuvalu
Passport Validity: 6 months
Tourist visa: Available upon arrival

Name: Tanzania
Passport Validity: 6 months
Tourist visa: Yes
Vaccionations: Yellow fever required if traveling from a yellow fever endemic country
Currency entry: Travelers are required to declare international currency valuing more than $10,000 on both entrance and exit from Tanzania. Non-residents (except Kenyans and Ugandans) may not import or export Tanzanian Shillings (TZS)
Currency Exit: Non-residents (except Kenyans and Ugandans) may not import or export Tanzanian Shillings (TZS)

Name: Uganda
Passport Validity: 6 months
Tourist visa: Yes

Name: Ukraine
Passport Validity: Must be valid at time of entry and exit
Passport pages: One page required for entry stamp
Tourist visa: Not required for tourism stays of less than 90 days within a 180-day period
Currency entry: Anything over €10,000 or foreign currency equivalent must be declared in writing

Name: Uruguay
Passport Validity: Must be valid at time of entry
Passport pages: One page required for entry stamp
Tourist visa: No, for stays less than 90 days. A visa is required when traveling on a diplomatic or official passport
Currency entry: $10,000.00; any amount greater must be declared with Uruguay’s customs authorities
Currency Exit: $10,000.00; any amount greater must be declared with Uruguay’s customs authorities

Name: Uzbekistan
Passport Validity: Must be valid at time of entry
Passport pages: One page required for entry stamp
Tourist visa: Yes
Vaccionations: None required. Vaccinations recommended by the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
Currency Exit: The amount of U.S. dollars or any foreign currency may not exceed the total declared by the traveler upon entry. If it does, the traveler must present bank documents showing the source of the additional currency

Name: Italy
Passport Validity: Must have at least six months validity remaining beyond your planned date of departure from the Schengen area.
Passport pages: Two pages required for entry stamp
Tourist visa: Not required for stays under 90 days

Name: Saint Vincent and the Grenadines
Passport Validity: Must be valid at time of entry
Tourist visa: None

Name: Venezuela
Passport Validity: 6 months.
Passport pages: One page required for entry stamp.
Tourist visa: You must get a Venezuelan visa before traveling to Venezuela. Visas are not available upon arrival. If you are a dual national, you must have a valid Venezuelan passport in your possession to enter and depart Venezuela.
Currency entry: USD 10,000 (or equivalent) or more must be declared.
Currency Exit: USD 10,000 (or equivalent) or more must be declared.

Name: British Virgin Islands
Passport Validity: Must be valid at time of entry
Tourist visa: Not required for stays up to one month

Name: Vietnam
Passport Validity: Must have six months’ validity remaining
Passport pages: One visa page required for entry stamp
Tourist visa: Yes
Currency entry: None. However, Vietnamese Dong in excess of VND 150,000,000 or foreign currency in excess of 5,000 U.S. dollars or equivalent must be declared.
Currency Exit: None. However, Vietnamese Dong in excess of VND 150,000,000 or foreign currency in excess of 5,000 U.S. dollars or equivalent must be declared.

Name: Vanuatu
Passport Validity: 6months
Tourist visa: Not required for stays under 30 days
Currency entry: Amounts over VUV 1,000,000 (USD 10,000) in local or foreign currency equivalent must be declared.
Currency Exit: Amounts over VUV 1,000,000 (USD 10,000) in local or foreign currency equivalent must be declared.

Name: Samoa
Passport Validity: Must be valid at the time of entry
Passport pages: One page requirement for entry stamp
Tourist visa: Not required for stays under 90 days

Name: Yemen
Passport Validity: Must be valid for six months at time of entry.
Passport pages: One page is required for entry stamp
Tourist visa: Yes. Must be obtained at Yemeni embassies and consulates abroad.

Name: South Africa
Passport Validity: 30 days
Passport pages: 2 consecutive empty visa pages per entry
Tourist visa: No, if visiting 90 days or less
Vaccionations: Yellow fever at least 10 days before arrival is required for travelers originating from or transiting through WHO-designated yellow fever countries
Currency entry: ZAR 25,000; Foreign currency unlimited if declared; No Kruger coins.
Currency Exit: ZAR 25,000; Foreign currency unlimited if amount was declared on entry; Up to 15 Kruger coins if proof purchased with foreign currency

Name: Zambia
Passport Validity: 6 months
Passport pages: 3 blank pages per entry for Zambia
Tourist visa: Yes
Vaccionations: Yellow fever, if entering from a yellow fever endemic country

Name: Zimbabwe
Passport Validity: Recommend 6 months.
Tourist visa: Yes, to be obtained at port of entry.
Currency Exit: 1,000 USD, more if declared/documented upon entry. See below.

Name: Brunei
Passport Validity: 6 months beyond arrival date
Passport pages: One page required for entry stamp, six blank visa pages
Tourist visa: Not required for stays under 90 days

Name: French West Indies
Passport Validity: Must have six months validity at entry
Tourist visa: Not required for stays under 90 days

Name: Kosovo
Passport Validity: Must be valid at time of entry
Passport pages: One page required for entry stamp
Tourist visa: Not required for visits less than 90 days in a six-month period
Currency entry: 10,000 euros or more in cash must be declared
Currency Exit: 10,000 euros or more in cash must be declared

Name: Israel, the West Bank and Gaza
Passport Validity: No minimum requirement, but your authorized stay will not exceed the validity remaining of your passport and airlines may decline boarding if a traveler has less than six months validity on his or her passport
Passport pages: 1 page (although passports are normally not stamped upon entry)
Tourist visa: Not required for stays of 90 days or less. Please see below for detailed information about entry, exit and visa requirements
Currency entry: You must declare if you are carrying 50,000 shekels or more when entering or exiting Israel by air and 12,000 shekels if entering or exiting by land
Currency Exit: You must declare if you are carrying 50,000 shekels or more when entering or exiting Israel by air and 12,000 shekels if entering or exiting by land

Name: Israel, the West Bank and Gaza
Passport Validity: No minimum requirement, but your authorized stay will not exceed the validity remaining of your passport and airlines may decline boarding if a traveler has less than six months validity on his or her passport
Passport pages: 1 page (although passports are normally not stamped upon entry)
Tourist visa: Not required for stays of 90 days or less. Please see below for detailed information about entry, exit and visa requirements
Currency entry: You must declare if you are carrying 50,000 shekels or more when entering or exiting Israel by air and 12,000 shekels if entering or exiting by land
Currency Exit: You must declare if you are carrying 50,000 shekels or more when entering or exiting Israel by air and 12,000 shekels if entering or exiting by land

Name: Kazakhstan
Passport Validity: Must be valid for three months at time of entry
Tourist visa: Those staying longer than 30 days or engaging in employment or missionary activities require a visa.

Name: Democratic Republic of the Congo (D.R.C.)
Passport Validity: 6 months
Tourist visa: Yes, obtain in advance

Name: Cameroon
Passport Validity: Six months
Tourist visa: Yes
Currency Exit: While there are no official restrictions, travelers are required to make a declaration when they are exiting with XAF 3,000,000 or more.

Name: Taiwan
Passport Validity: Valid throughout duration of stay
Tourist visa: Not required for stay of less than 90 days
Vaccionations: None required. Taiwan’s Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) recommends travelers to Taiwan be vaccinated against Hepatitis A. Vaccination information can be found here.
Currency entry: Declare cash amounts over 100,000 New Taiwan Dollars (TWD), foreign currencies over 10,000 USD, or over 20,000 Chinese Yuan (RMB). Customs details are here.
Currency Exit: Declare cash amounts over 100,000 New Taiwan Dollars (TWD), foreign currencies over 10,000 USD, or over 20,000 Chinese Yuan (RMB). Customs details are here.
